title: Class 8 truck manufacturers - sales 2007 to 2018
summary: This is a multi line chart with 6 lines denoting Freightliner, Ford, Kenworth, Mack, Peterbilt, and Volvo Truck. The y axis indicates the Truck sales in thousands and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Freightliner, Kenworth, Peterbilt, and Volvo Truck are gradually increasing, Ford, and Mack are roughly constant,  throughout the Year.
Overall across the Year, Freightliner mostly maintained the highest Truck sales in thousands when compared to others with a mean value of 64.55, and it peaked at 2015.
Followed by Ford which ranks as the second topmost line , with an average of 29.9 Truck sales in thousands,reaching its highest point  at 2011 with a value of 35.9.
The botommost line, Mack,  has a mean of 14.98, and peaked at 2015.

max_summary: This is a multi-line chart with 6 lines representing Freightliner, Ford, Kenworth, Mack, Peterbilt, and Volvo Truck. The y axis denotes Truck sales in thousands and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Freightliner, Kenworth, Peterbilt, and Volvo Truck are gradually increasing, Ford, and Mack are roughly constant,  throughout the Year.
Throughout the period, Freightliner generally had the highest Truck sales in thousands relative to others with an average of 64.55, and it reached its maximum at 2015 with a value of 100.21.
After Freightliner, Ford overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 29.9, peaking at 2011.
Mack mostly had the least Truck sales in thousands with a mean value of 14.98, which peaked at 2015 with a value of 19.83.
Volvo Truck reported the lowest Truck sales in thousands about 7.07 in Year 2009
